title: How to Make Fortune Cookies

steps.headline: Measure out strips for your fortunes on a piece of paper.
steps.description: The strips should be about 3" (7.6cm) long and 1/2" (1.25cm) wide. Write your fortunes out and then cut the strips. You'll need about 15 fortunes.

steps.headline: Preheat oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C).
Beat the egg white in a bowl.
steps.description: Add vanilla extract, almond extract and vegetable oil.

steps.headline: Put flour, cornstarch, sugar, and salt into a separate bowl.
Add the flour, cornstarch, sugar, and salt mixture into the egg, vanilla, and almond mixture.
steps.description: Stir until you have a smooth batter.

steps.headline: Place tablespoons of batter onto the cookie sheet, spacing them around 2 or 3 inches (5 - 7.5cm) apart.
steps.description: Tilt the baking sheet back and forth, side to side, until each tablespoon of batter forms into a circle 4 inches (10cm) in diameter.

steps.headline: Bake for 15 minutes, or until the outer half turns to a golden brown color, and they are easy to remove from the baking sheet.
Remove the cookie with a spatula, and flip it over in your hand.
steps.description: Place the fortune in the middle of the cookie.

steps.headline: Form the fortune cookie shape: fold the cookie in half, then gently pull the edges downward over the rim of a glass or wooden spoon.
Place the finished cookie in the cup of a muffin tin or teacup or whatever you think will work best so that it keeps its shape.
steps.description: Continue with the rest of the cookies.

text: Measure out strips for your fortunes on a piece of paper. The strips should be about 3" (7.6cm) long and 1/2" (1.25cm) wide. Write your fortunes out and then cut the strips. You'll need about 15 fortunes. Preheat oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C).  Beat the egg white in a bowl. Add vanilla extract, almond extract and vegetable oil. Put flour, cornstarch, sugar, and salt into a separate bowl. Stir in the water. Add the flour, cornstarch, sugar, and salt mixture into the egg, vanilla, and almond mixture. Stir until you have a smooth batter. Place tablespoons of batter onto the cookie sheet, spacing them around 2 or 3 inches (5 - 7.5cm) apart. Tilt the baking sheet back and forth, side to side, until each tablespoon of batter forms into a circle 4 inches (10cm) in diameter. Bake for 15 minutes, or until the outer half turns to a golden brown color, and they are easy to remove from the baking sheet.  Remove the cookie with a spatula, and flip it over in your hand. Place the fortune in the middle of the cookie. Form the fortune cookie shape: fold the cookie in half, then gently pull the edges downward over the rim of a glass or wooden spoon.  Place the finished cookie in the cup of a muffin tin or teacup or whatever you think will work best so that it keeps its shape. Continue with the rest of the cookies. Finished.
sentences: Measure out strips for your fortunes on a piece of paper.
The strips should be about 3" (7.6cm) long and 1/2" (1.25cm) wide.
Write your fortunes out and then cut the strips.
You'll need about 15 fortunes.
Preheat oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C).
Beat the egg white in a bowl.
Add vanilla extract, almond extract and vegetable oil.
Put flour, cornstarch, sugar, and salt into a separate bowl.
Stir in the water.
Add the flour, cornstarch, sugar, and salt mixture into the egg, vanilla, and almond mixture.
Stir until you have a smooth batter.
Place tablespoons of batter onto the cookie sheet, spacing them around 2 or 3 inches (5 - 7.5cm) apart.
Tilt the baking sheet back and forth, side to side, until each tablespoon of batter forms into a circle 4 inches (10cm) in diameter.
Bake for 15 minutes, or until the outer half turns to a golden brown color, and they are easy to remove from the baking sheet.
Remove the cookie with a spatula, and flip it over in your hand.
Place the fortune in the middle of the cookie.
Form the fortune cookie shape: fold the cookie in half, then gently pull the edges downward over the rim of a glass or wooden spoon.
Place the finished cookie in the cup of a muffin tin or teacup or whatever you think will work best so that it keeps its shape.
Continue with the rest of the cookies.
Finished.
